topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
topic.title: couchbase-cli commands

row.entry: List all servers in a cluster
Add one or more servers to the cluster
Readds a server that was failed over
Show status of current cluster rebalancing
Set the username,password and port of the cluster
List all buckets in a cluster
Add a new bucket to the cluster
Flush all data from disk for a given bucket
Set XDCR-related configuration which affect behavior.
Create and run replication via XDCR

section.title: couchbase-cli command options
section.p: The following are options which can be used with their respective commands. Administration — couchbase-cli Tool commands options:

row.entry: Displays all server in a server group (Enterprise Edition only)
Admin username for the server to be added
Admin password for the server to be added
Server group where the server is to be added (Enterprise Edition only)
Admin username for the server to be added
Admin password for the server to be added
Server group where the server is to be added (Enterprise Edition only)
Shows the server groups and the server assigned to each server group
Moves a list of server from a group
Moves one or more servers from a group.
Moves one or more server to a group
The server to remove from cluster
Per node RAM quota in MB
Per node path to store data
Per node path to store index
Bucket type, either memcached or couchbase
Supports ASCII protocol and does not require authentication
Wait for bucket create to be complete before returning
Force command execution without asking for confirmation
Percentage of disk fragmentation when database compaction is triggered
Size of disk fragmentation when database compaction is triggered
Percentage of disk fragmentation when views compaction is triggered
Size of disk fragmentation when views compaction is triggered
Enable compaction from this time onwards
Stop enabling compaction at this time
Allow compaction to abort when time expires
Allow parallel compaction processes for database and view
Email recipents, separate addresses with, or ;
Email encryption with 0 the default for no encryption
Node was failed over via autofailover
Maximum number of auto failover nodes reached
Node not auto failed-over as other nodes are down at the same time
Node not auto failed-over as cluster was too small
Disk space used for persistent storage has reached at least 90% capacity
Metadata overhead is more than 50% of RAM for node
Bucket memory on a node is entirely used for metadata
Writing data to disk for a specific bucket has failed
Specify amount of node timeout that triggers auto failover
Maximum concurrent replicators per bucket, 8 to 256.
Interval for restarting failed xdcr, 1 to 300 seconds
Document body size threshold (bytes) to trigger optimistic replication
Remote host name to connect to
Enables data encryption using Secure Socket Layer (SSL). 1 (one) enables data encryption. Default: 0 (Enterprise Edition only)

Specifies the pem-encoded certificate. The certificate is required for XDCR data encryption. Specify the full path for the location of the pem-encoded certificate file on the source cluster. (Enterprise Edition only)
Create and start a new replication
Source bucket name to replicate from
Select REST protocol or memcached for replication. xmem indicates memcached while capi indicates REST protocol.

Regenerates a self-signed certificate on the destination cluster. Specify the full path for the location of the pem-encoded certificate file. For example, --regenerate-cert=./new.pem. (Enterprise Edition only)

Retrieves the self-signed certificate from the destination cluster to the source cluster. Specify a local location (full path) and file name for the pem-encoded certificate. For example, --retrieve-cert=./newCert.pem. (Enterprise Edition only)
